abstract: The SLM Corporation, parent of the student lender Sallie Mae, and an investor group led by J. C. Flowers & Company agreed Wednesday to language enabling the company to operate without the oversight of investors while they battle in court over their collapsed $25 billion buyout.
lead_paragraph: The SLM Corporation, parent of the student lender Sallie Mae, and an investor group led by J. C. Flowers & Company agreed Wednesday to language enabling the company to operate without the oversight of investors while they battle in court over their collapsed $25 billion buyout.

headline.main: Sallie Mae, Buyers Strike Deal on Waivers
